qpe_definition.special_rules: QAPE (Qualifying Australian Production Expenditure) includes all expenditure directly related to production incurred in Australia. For theatrically-released feature films (including animation): 40% offset. For non-theatrical features, TV series, short-form animation: 30% offset.

spv_requirements: Applicant must be an Australian company that qualifies as an Australian resident for tax purposes. Significant Australian content required.
notes: The Producer Offset is one of three offsets under the Australian Screen Production Incentive. Animation features intended for theatrical release receive the 40% rate. Short-form animation and TV animation receive the 30% rate. The offset is refundable - if the offset exceeds the company's tax liability, the excess is refunded. Can be combined with state/territory incentives and the PDV Offset for post/VFX work. Minimum QAPE of AUD $500,000 required. Must meet Significant Australian Content test. Administered by Screen Australia and the Australian Tax Office.
